block.p: Your Oct. 22 editorial ''Enlightenment on Energy'' cautions the Senate against energy legislation that focuses on drilling for oil ''while giving short shrift to the demand side'' of the equation.

President Bush's national energy plan is well balanced. It promotes conservation, expands energy supplies (including renewable energies like wind, solar, biomass and geothermal) and addresses our beleaguered energy infrastructure. All of these aim at greater energy independence in the interest of national security.
Your Oct. 22 editorial ''Enlightenment on Energy'' cautions the Senate against energy legislation that focuses on drilling for oil ''while giving short shrift to the demand side'' of the equation.

President Bush's national energy plan is well balanced. It promotes conservation, expands energy supplies (including renewable energies like wind, solar, biomass and geothermal) and addresses our beleaguered energy infrastructure. All of these aim at greater energy independence in the interest of national security.
Of the 105 recommendations in the president's plan, 54 relate to improving energy efficiency and expanding our use of clean, renewable energy sources.

The country needs an honest, informed and responsible discussion of energy policy for us to improve our energy security. The president and the House have already acted on a balanced plan. The Senate should do the same.
SPENCER ABRAHAM Secretary of Energy Washington, Oct. 25, 2001
